      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a Blueprints "building" from res/building.txt, scores the materials in that building, and writes the result to res/scoring-results.txt.
        Parameters:
        args - any command line arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • writeResultsToFile

        public void writeResultsToFile​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building,
                               java.lang.String resultsPath)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the building to score and that building's score details to res/scoring-results.txt. The details are as follows:
        • If the incoming building is empty, the output file contains the text "No building present."
        • If the incoming building is not empty, the output file contains:
          1. The text version of the building being scored.
          2. A blank line.
          3. A formatted scoring table, as specified in the assignment.
        Parameters:
        building - the building to score
        resultsPath - the path to the results file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getGlassScore

        public int getGlassScore​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building)
        Returns the score for the glass dice in the provided building. From page 4 of the rulebook: "Score each clear die individually; the clear die being scored is worth the value of its top face."
        Parameters:
        building - the building to score
        Returns:
        the glass materials score

      • getRecycledScore

        public int getRecycledScore​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building)
        Returns the score for the recycled dice in the provided building. From page 4 of the rulebook: "Score a total of 2/5/10/15/20/30 points for using a total of 1/2/3/4/5/6 green dice."
        Parameters:
        building - the building to score
        Returns:
        the recycled materials score

      • getStoneScore

        public int getStoneScore​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building)
        Returns the score for the stone dice in the provided building. From page 4 of the rulebook: "Score each black die individually; the black die being scored is worth 2/3/5/8 points for being on the 1st/2nd/3rd/4th (or higher) level of a building."
        Parameters:
        building - the building to score
        Returns:
        the stone materials score

      • getWoodScore

        public int getWoodScore​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building)
        Returns the score for the wood dice in the provided building. From page 4 of the rulebook: "Score each orange die individually; score 2 points per die adjacent to the orange die being scored. Dice are adjacent if they share a face."
        Parameters:
        building - the building to score
        Returns:
        the wood materials score

      • findNeighbourCount

        public int findNeighbourCount​(java.lang.String dieToInspect,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> building)

      • formattedScoringReport

        public java.lang.String formattedScoringReport​(int glassScore,
                                               int recycledScore,
                                               int stoneScore,
                                               int woodScore)
        Returns a formatted table of material scores, as well as a total score. Assumption: No individual score, or total score, will have more than two digits.
        Parameters:
        glassScore - the glass score to display
        recycledScore - the recycled score to display
        stoneScore - the stone score to display
        woodScore - the wood score to display
        Returns:
        the formatted table of scores
